method: Wix Pro Gallery API via browser

cards.title: A Loving God
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Field Card. Both Players cannot battle for 3 full turn cycles. This effect starts from the moment this card is played until three turn cycles have been completed and the player who laid this card has completed their draw step. At that time combat can be initiated again and this card leaves the field.

cards.title: Allosaurus
cards.flavorText: While not as large as the T-Rex, the Allosaurus is still very deadly as they are known to travel in packs to survive.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: On Hit, the target creature takes 10 bleed damage. This damage over time effect occurs after the combat step has concluded for the turn this effect was applied. Damage over time effects are flat damage and receive no bonuses. This effect is continuous as long as this card is on the field. After the initial damage that occurs on hit, the effect of the Damage Over Time occurs once per turn cycle after the conclusion of the combat step.

cards.title: Angel
cards.flavorText: Angels are the embodiment of the light, and main force of the creator. They are under direct control of the Eternal Titan.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When summoned, return a creature from your cemetery to your hand. This card cannot be returned from the cemetery. Creatures that are sacrificed to summon the Angel to the field are eligible to be affected by the Angels effect.

cards.title: Assassin
cards.flavorText: Although not the best combat artist, the Assassin is a master of stealth and deadly sneak attacks.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: If the Assassin hits first during a battle step then the total damage, after all dice rolls plus modifiers is calculated, is tripled. Multipliers are the last thing applied to the addition and multiplication equation for calculating damage. Additional multipliers can be applied to this card and added at the end of the equation.

cards.title: Backstab
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, this card allows a target creature on your side of the field to have the following effects: Attack first during battle, Automatically Hit regardless of the result of the Hit Dice Roll, and apply a 3x Damage multiplier at the end of your damage calculations (multiple backstabs or any other creature/magic cards that add a damage multiplier would be multiplied together, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage. Example: 3 Backstab’s 3*3*3=27x damage multiplier). This card's ability to automatically Hit would supersede the creature effect of scarlet or other hit reducing cards such as ring of extremes.

cards.title: Ball and Chain
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip: Target a creature and reduce the equipped creature's speed stat by 6 points as long as this card is equipped to that card. This card remains in the magic play area of the person who played it. This card negates any speed stat increases from other creature effects or magic cards.

cards.title: Basilisk
cards.flavorText: This monster searches the darkest areas of the world for its prey. Even dragons fear the mighty Basilisk.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: While on the field the target creature takes 5 poison damage once per turn cycle until this card leaves the field. This effect occurs at the end of the combat phase and prior to the wrap-up phase.

cards.title: Behemoth
cards.flavorText: These creatures spend their free time tracking down adventurers for an easy kill.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Black Dragon
cards.flavorText: Black dragons were formally red dragons. They betrayed their brethren and allied with the Fire God. This turned their scales as black as ash.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, roll 1 die. If 6, your opponent must skip their next turn. This completely skips your opponent's turn. If you rolled a 6 at the end of your turn you will then begin a new turn and start by drawing a card as if your opponent had just ended their turn.

cards.title: Blade in the Dark
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When your opponent casts a magic card, negate the card effect and send it to the cemetery. This card stops the activation of another magic card and therefore the attempted to be played magic card never has its effect activated and will go to the cemetery. Example: Heroism magic card is immune to magic cards. However, due to Blade in the Dark negating the magic card before its effect can occur, Blade in the Dark would destroy the Heroism magic card and send it to the cemetery.

cards.title: Blood of the Bat
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip: Add lifesteal to this creature. Heal the equipped creature for half the amount of attack damage the equipped card inflicts on the target creature it attacks. If a reflect spell or or other block spell is used the creature equipped with Blood of the bat does not heal. Only direct battle damage counts towards this card's effect.

cards.title: Blue Dragon
cards.flavorText: While not as powerful as the red dragons, blue dragons are cunning beasts of the winter frost.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: On hit, roll 1 die. If 4-6, your target is frozen for one turn cycle and cannot battle or be sacrificed. If a creature is frozen during a battle and the frozen creature goes second they cannot rebuttal during that battle. A frozen creature may be killed and another creature can be summoned. However, the frozen creature cannot be used as sacrifice material for the newly summoned creature.

cards.title: Children of the Forest
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: On hit, play this card from your hand. Add 5 extra Attack dice rolls to your attacking creature for this battle. This only adds extra damage to an attack. This card does not add extra Hit Dice rolls.

cards.title: Cosmic Demon
cards.flavorText: An eternal being of destruction. If the Creator shaped the cosmos, then the Cosmic Demon will be the one to destroy it.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Cosmic Negation
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Field: Destroy all magic cards on the field. Magic cards cannot be played or activated for 3 turn cycles. This affects the entire play field. Once the 3 turn cycles have concluded Cosmic Negation is destroyed and sent to the Cemetery.

cards.title: Council of the Cosmos
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Destroy 1 magic card on the field.

cards.title: Curse
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Field: All creatures on the opposing side field have their Armor Level reduced to 1. This card supersedes other Armor Level increasing cards. This card does not affect cards such as Heroism due to the card's antimagic effect.

cards.title: Dark Elf
cards.flavorText: These elves are followers of the dark arcane arts. Dark Elves are considered mysterious to the civilized world.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this card hits, roll 1 die, If the result of this dice roll is 1-3 you can roll 4 extra Attack Dice for this battle. This effect can only be applied once per battle.

cards.title: Dark Knight
cards.flavorText: Once a knight of The Light. These wicked beings have fallen to a darker path on the road to justice.They do not see themselves as evil.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During the player who controls this card's turn this creature may summon 1 undead creature back to the field from the card owner's cemetery as a limited summoned creature. This card may only control 1 summoned undead on the field at a time. If this effect is nullified in any way, or this card leaves the field for any reason, send the summoned undead creature back to the cemetery. Summoned creatures may be sent back to the owner's hand through various card effects such as Wrath of the Old ones. Summoned undead do not change ownership along with Dark Knight if Dark Knight changes ownership through various card effects.

cards.title: Dark Lord
cards.flavorText: Dark ruler of the Under Lands. This man has devoted himself to proving that men can be as powerful as gods.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Death from Above
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card affects all creatures on your side of the field: For one turn cycle, this card allows creatures under your control on your side of the field to hit their targets regardless of the result of the Hit Dice roll. Double 6’s (Critical Hit damage) still applies and does double damage. Critical Misses do not count against the player who used this card. This card's ability to automatically Hit would supersede the creature effect of scarlet or other hit reducing cards such as ring of extremes.

cards.title: Demon
cards.flavorText: The main force of the Demon King's army. These creatures thrive on inflicting pain. Demons have an uncanny hatred for the undead, seeing them as an abomination.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Demon King
cards.flavorText: The ruler of Hell, and enemy of The Light. The Demon King has led two full scale invasions into Ward. Both were a terrible failure. He answers only to the Cosmic Demon, however, he shares no love for his celestial master.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, you may roll 1 die. If the result of the dice roll is 1-2, destroy all magic cards on your opponent's side of the field.

cards.title: Demon Knight
cards.flavorText: During the empire of man many knights sold their souls to the demon king in exchange for power. They now hold more power than any human knight, but are bound to hell for an eternity of torment.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your turn roll 1 die. If the result of the dice roll is 4-6 your opponent's primary creature is burned for 10 Health Points of damage.

cards.title: Demonic Magic
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a creature on the field. Once equipped the equipped creature has their remaining Health Points reduced by half and gain +5 to both their Hit and Attack Modifiers. This card has a secondary effect that negates all creature effects for any creature on the field. Continuous effects such as Necromancer's resurrection abilities would be stopped and the resurrected creature would be sent back to the cemetery until this card's effect ends.

cards.title: Dimorphodon
cards.flavorText: These winged creatures are said to eat the eggs of larger dinosaurs and dragons. Due to their winged form, they are able to hide amongst dragonlings in order to get close enough to steal their parents' eggs.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Dire Wolf
cards.flavorText: The largest of the wild wolves. Dire Wolves are known to rip the flesh from the bones of their prey whilst still alive. Orcs have been known to tame these wild beasts and use them as mounts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the targeted creature takes 10 bleed damage once per turn cycle for 3 turn cycles. Bleed Damage is applied after the battle phase in which it was applied and at the end of the battle phase after 1 full turn cycle. If battle did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up”.

cards.title: Dragon Fire
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Destroy all magic cards on the field. This includes the side of the field for the player who uses this card.

cards.title: Dragon Fox
cards.flavorText: While not as strong as its scaly brethren, Dragon Fox have developed telekinetic abilities to fight their foes.They may be cute, but they are highly intelligent, and ruthless if provoked.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the targeted creature must roll 1 attack die against itself. Do not add any modifiers or other additional buffs to this damage.

cards.title: Dragon Power
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this magic card to a creature. The equipped creature increases its armor level to 12 and gains +5 to its Hit Modifier, and +10 to Attack Modifier. The creature for whom this card is equipped must do damage during your turn or this card is destroyed. Reflect abilities and magic cards do not count towards the damage requirement. Damage over time effects and other prolonged damaging abilities which are caused by the equipped card count towards this damage requirement effect.

cards.title: Dragon Rage
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When your opponent uses a magic card or lands an attack, the owner of the card may decide whether to negate the activation of the magic card or negate the Attack damage. After negating the magic card or the Attack damage, destroy all magic cards on the field. Following the destruction of all magic cards on the field both players must draw 3 cards if they are able.

cards.title: Dragon Tamer
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card allows you to search your deck for one creature that has “Dragon” anywhere in its name, or is a “Dragon” type creature. Place the creature into your hand and then shuffle your deck.

cards.title: Dragon's Bane
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card is a field card and affects all creatures on the field. All “Dragon” type creatures, or creatures with “Dragon” in their name take 2x Attack  damage.

cards.title: Dragonling
cards.flavorText: Even at this young age Dragonlings are still dangerous for adventures to slay. Hundreds are born at a time, but only the strongest will age into full grown adult dragons.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Dwarf
cards.flavorText: Dwarves are hardy mountain folk. They are fierce warriors and cunning craftsmen. They tend to care little for the world outside of the mountains and caves. They are too busy dealing with Kobolds and Golbins of the mountains.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Elf
cards.flavorText: Elves are fallen Angels who have lost their Light. Their purpose is to shepherd the world and help it grow. They have allied themselves with The Order, and provide wisdom whereas the humans provide enforcement and law.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After rolling the attack die this card triples the amount of damage that would have occurred to the target creature. This effect can only occur to creatures who have wings as listed as an attribute or are part of their creature image. This can be seen from the creature's picture or the extended card descriptions list. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits and other multiplying card effects, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, +1 dmg for modifier, 3x for the creature effect, 3x for the magic card Backstab, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows (3+1)*3(Effect)*2(Critical)*3(Backstab)=72 total Attack damage to the target creature.

cards.title: Ent Tree
cards.flavorText: The Ent Tree is as old as Ward itself. Legend says that some of these creatures grow fruit from their branches and can become incredibly hostile to anyone who touches it.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This creature is unaffected by creature effects and magic card effects. This only applies to creature or magic effects that would affect this creature. This effect includes both negative and beneficial cards alike. Additionally, this card does 2x Attack damage to any creature cards where the creature is holding a weapon. This effect can only occur to creatures who are holding a weapon as listed as an attribute and/or are holding a weapon in their creature image. This can be seen from the creature's picture and/or the extended card descriptions list. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, +6 dmg for modifier, 2x for the creature effect, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows: (3+6)*2(Effect)*2(Critical)=36 total Attack damage to the target creature. Use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage.

cards.title: Epic Boots
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level and Speed stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 4 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Epic Helm
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level and Hit modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 4 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Epic Loot
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level and Speed stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 5 each. Add 1 Dice roll to the equipped creatures Attack dice rolls and Hit dice rolls. Heal the equipped creature to full health. This heal only occurs one time, and must occur immediately once equipped. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Epic Ring
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 4 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Eternal Dragon
cards.flavorText: A monster of legend. Many believe it does not exist, while others believe it will bring about the end times. It is the embodiment of dragons combining their power with the power of The Old God.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This creature requires 2 cards that have “Dragon” in their names or are dragon type to summon to the field. Once summoned, place both cards used to summon this creature on the field underneath this card. If this creature leaves the field or changes control, all cards underneath this card follow it. This card and the subsequent cards underneath it may be used as 1 sacrifice in the summoning of another Eternal Dragon. Cards equipped to the creatures used to sacrificed for Eternal Dragon are transferred to and are now equipped to Eternal Dragon after summoning Eternal Dragon.

cards.title: Eternal Titan
cards.flavorText: The Eternal Titan scours the cosmos eradicating corruption in the wake of the Cosmic Demon. He does not bother with the events of any single planet. He was created out of the rage of The Creator.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your turn you may roll 1 die. If the result of that roll is either a 5 or 6 your opponent cannot activate magic cards for 1 cycle. Cards currently on the field are not affected by the creature effect and remain active.

cards.title: Evolved Dino
cards.flavorText: The product of dinosaurs surviving extinction in a parallel reality. This being was experimenting with time travel in his universe when he got thrust into another.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This creature does 3 times damage to any Cosmic type creatures or creatures who have stars as part of their creature image, or listed as an attribute. This can be seen from the creature's picture or the extended card descriptions list. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits and other multiplying card effects, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage.. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, +3 dmg for modifier, 3x for the creature effect, 3x for the magic card Backstab, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows (3+3)*3(Effect)*2(Critical)*3(Backstab)=108 total Attack damage to the target creature.

cards.title: Fear
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip Fear to a creature on the field. Fear remains attached to the equipped creature until either Fear is destroyed, the equipped creature leaves the field, or changes control. The targeted creature is feared. Prior to each battle the equipped creature must roll 1 die. If the result is 1-4 they may attack normally. During the equipped creatures turn they may initiate combat. However, they must roll the die and receive a result of 1-4 to battle. If they fail this roll they are still in combat and the opposing creature may attack them as a rebuttal.

cards.title: Fire God
cards.flavorText: This deity is a living embodiment of the Flame of the Infinite. His sole purpose is to burn everything and feed the eternal flame. It proved to be too much for the armies of Hell during the First Demonic Invasion of Ward.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this card hits, the target creature takes 10 fire damage once per turn cycle for 2 turn cycles. The first DOT is applied after the Combat Phase in which it was applied. This counts as the first of the two turn cycles, so one more DOT would remain. The second DOT charge is applied after the Combat Phase, 1 turn cycle after it was applied.

cards.title: Flame of the Infinite
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card affects all creatures under your control. All creatures under your control gain 5 to their Armor Level, Speed, and Attack Modifier stats. Additionally, they also gain 1 additional dice roll to their Hit dice rolls and Attack dice rolls.

cards.title: Foolish Tricks
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Your opponent must return all of their cards on the field back to their hand. Your opponent may only summon an Armor Level 6 or lower creature to the field in response. If they cannot summon a creature Armor Level 6 or lower they must reshuffle their hand into their deck and redraw until they can play. If they have no remaining Armor Level 6 or lower creatures in their deck they lose the game.

cards.title: Forest Demon
cards.flavorText: Escaped demons from the ranks of the Demon King. Forest Demons seek to inflict pain on any who enter their woods.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature is killed by battle, equip it to the attacking creature. If this card is killed by anything other than battle, send it to the cemetery. When this card is equipped to a creature, reduce the equipped creature's following stats by half: Armor Level, Speed, Attack Dice, and Modifier (Round up if a fraction). While equipped, this creature remains on your side of the field in a magic slot, and is now an infinite equip magic card. The owner of Forest Demon must have an available magic slot for this effect to occur, otherwise send this creature to the cemetery when it dies.

cards.title: Forest Fire
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Once per turn cycle your opponent(s) must roll a die. If the result is 4-6 destroy this card. If a player rolls a 1-3 their primary creature takes 10 Health Points of damage. If there is more than 1 player rolling for the effect of this card each player's primary creature who rolls a 1-3 would take 10 damage. Example: If 3 people roll for this effect and 2 roll 1-3 and 1 person rolls 4-6. The people who rolled 1-3 take the 10 damage each but the card is also destroyed due to the third person rolling the 4-6.

cards.title: Forest Sentinel
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After your opponent has finished doing their attack calculations to determine the amount of damage your creature will take, play this card. Negate any damage your creature would have taken from this direct attack only and reflect it back at the attacking creature. This cards reflection cannot be blocked by cards such as junk scarecrow or minotaur bodyguard.

cards.title: Frog
cards.flavorText: Frogs are small creatures that live in swamps. They may be easy to kill, but they swarm by the 1000’s.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Frog Man
cards.flavorText: Frog men are known to be heavily armored, but not very strong. They use their long tongue to pull enemies in close to strike.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card requires no sacrifice(s) to summon to the field. This is considered a summoning requirement and is not to be treated as an effect. This is considered a Summoning Requirement and therefore is considered a Non-Effect creature while on the field. This effect cannot be negated by cards such as Mind Sap or Iron Range.

cards.title: Frost Giant
cards.flavorText: The frost giants are feared creatures of the icy north. One of the only mortal beings that the dragons see as a threat. They are said to guard the final resting place of the Undead King.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Ghost of the Past
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Return a creature from your cemetery back to your hand.

cards.title: Giant Bat
cards.flavorText: Blind and dangerous. The Giant Bat is said to strike from the dark on unlucky adventures. They like to nest in the hair of sleeping women.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Giant Eagle
cards.flavorText: A spectacular and fantastic beast. The Giant Eagle is said to reach lightning speeds of over 200 mph. They directly combat the dragons for control of the skies.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Giant Rat
cards.flavorText: Small and vicious scavengers. Most places would love to see these vermin go extinct.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: If this card is sacrificed to summon another creature to the field, send this card back to your deck and shuffle.

cards.title: Giant Spider
cards.flavorText: There is nothing more terrifying than a giant spider skittering out of the darkness towards you. These creatures dwell in the deep moist caverns throughout Ward.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the targeted creature takes 10 damage once per turn cycle for 2 turn cycles. Damage is applied after the battle phase in which it was applied and at the end of the battle phase after 1 full turn cycle. If battle did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up”.

cards.title: Giant Turtle
cards.flavorText: This creature is slow moving, but incredibly durable. The Giant Turtle can withstand even the strongest attacks.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Reduce all damage this creature takes by half if Giant Turtle has a speed stat that is lower than your opponent's primary creature.

cards.title: Giga
cards.flavorText: A colossal being from the prehistoric times. The raw physical power was even enough to make many cosmic beings fear the mighty giga. If you see one of these dinos, RUN!!
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Glarbstenford
cards.flavorText: This barbarian is known for attacking everything with his trusted axe. Not all of those fights result in victory. He has been banished on occasion from his local village due to bad habits and name-calling.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Add 1 additional Attack dice if the target Glarbstenford is attacking has an Armor Level less than that of Glarbstenford. This includes any magic cards added to Glabstenford or his target's Armor Level.

cards.title: Gnome
cards.flavorText: Smaller than both Halflings and Dwarves. Gnomes are extremely handy with technology and steam works. Their mayoral is boosted when in large numbers.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: For every card in your hand with “Gnome” in its name, add an extra Attack Dice roll and +1 to your Hit and Attack Modifier. To use this effect you must present the “Gnome” cards in your hand to your opponent.

cards.title: Goblin
cards.flavorText: Goblins are not very strong creatures. They make up for their lack of strength by traveling in hordes to swarm and overwhelm their foes with sheer numbers.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Goblin Tricks
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card from your hand when your opponent activates a magic card from their hand to the field. You may either negate the activation/playing of that magic card and send it to your opponents cemetery. If you do not choose to stop the activation/playing of that magic card you may instead destroy 1 magic card that is already on the field.

cards.title: Griffin
cards.flavorText: The Griffin is an intelligent and ferocious creature. They soar on the high winds spotting prey. They will dive at lightning speeds to stun their prey before finishing them off.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Grizzly Bear
cards.flavorText: While not normally aggressive, the Grizzly Bear will attack any foe they deem a threat to their territory. They are feared by even the strongest of foes, and have been known to hunt Forest Demons.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the targeted creature takes 10 damage once per turn cycle for 2 turn cycles. Damage is applied after the battle phase in which it was applied and at the end of the battle phase after 1 full turn cycle. If battle did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up”.

cards.title: Hafling
cards.flavorText: Due to their small size, Halflings are not known for being the best warriors. However, they excel at stealth and are quite good cooks.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card does 2x attack damage if this card hits first during battle. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, +0 dmg for modifier, 2x for the creature effect, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows: (3+0)*2(Effect)*2(Critical)=12 total Attack damage to the target creature. Use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage.

cards.title: Harpy
cards.flavorText: Cursed by the Eternal Titan for treason against the light. Harpies are fallen Angels who are stuck in Limbo. They are cursed by the light, but not evil enough to be welcomed by Hell.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Healing Tree
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card is a single use card. Play this card to the field and heal one of your creatures for 50hp. Healed creatures total Health Points cannot exceed the maximum HP stat.

cards.title: Health Potion
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card is a single use card. Play this card to the field and heal one of your creatures for 30hp. Healed creatures total Health Points cannot exceed the maximum HP stat.

cards.title: Hell Skeleton
cards.flavorText: These undead were average skeletons who killed powerful demons and absorbed their power. They now have the ability to control a tainted form of Hell Fire.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After all damage has been calculated this creature doubles the final result of its total damage against any creature with Demon in their name or is a Demon type creature. After rolling the attack die this card doubles the amount of damage that would have occurred to the target creature. This effect can only occur to creatures who have Demon in their name or is a Demon type creature. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits and other multiplying card effects, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, 2, 2 +2 dmg for modifier, 2x for the creature effect, 3x for the magic card Backstab, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows (3+2+2+2)*2(Effect)*2(Critical)*3(Backstab)=108 total Attack damage to the target creature.

cards.title: Helping Hand
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field. This card allows the player to summon any creature from their hand to the field as a limited summon. While the limited summoned creature is on the field this card acts as an anchor for the limited summoned creature. This card is equipped to the limited summoned creature and must remain equipped to the summoned creature. If this card is destroyed, removed from the field, or the creature changes player control the attached creature is sent to your cemetery.

cards.title: Hero Shield
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.affectsBoss: Yes, if used on a boss.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 4. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Heroism
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.affectsBoss: Yes, if used on a boss. If equipped to a player creature, roll a die each time the boss uses a magic card that Heroism would normally repel. If the magic succeeds, it bypasses Heroism permanently for that cards effect (if ongoing, no further rolls are needed). If there is a contradiction the situation is whatever benefits the boss the most.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level, Hit modifier, and Attack modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 2. Additionally, this card and the equipped creature are immune to all other magic cards other than this card. This includes beneficial and negatively impacting magic cards. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time. This card can be destroyed/negated during its initial activation by other magic cards. This card can be destroyed by creature effects while on the field.

cards.title: Hive Lord
cards.flavorText: A deranged man who devoted his life to speaking with insects. After years of isolation, he discovered the secrets to communicating with insects through secreting different pheromones from his own body.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When summoned to the field choose one magic card on the field and destroy it.

cards.title: Holy Light
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field. After it has been played you may return any card from your cemetery to your hand. Some cards have exceptions to this rule, such as Angel, who cannot be removed from the cemetery.

cards.title: Holy Water
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: All creatures on the field do 2x additional damage to any undead creatures on the field. This card is a field card and all creatures on the field receive its effect.

cards.title: Hourglass of Time
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to completely reset either you or your opponent's turn. The turn that is reset is determined by which player’s turn it was when this card was played. Resetting the turn includes all events and actions that have happened during the turn it was played and resets them back to just prior to when the players, whose turn it is, was about to draw a card. This card cannot be returned from the cemetery. This includes being returned from the cemetery by resetting the turn by another hourglass of Time effect.

cards.title: Jester
cards.flavorText: Even in the presence of royalty, this clown will make light of any person, place, or situation.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: If this card is destroyed by battle, inflict 10 Health Points of damage to the attacking creature. If this magic card “Bomb” is on the field when this card is destroyed by battle, send “Bomb” to the cemetery.

cards.title: Judgement
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Return all creatures on the field to their original owners hand. This includes any magic cards that are currently acting as a creature and are in the creature play slots. Each player must then summon a creature with an Armor Level of 6 or less. If either player has no Armor Level 6 or lower creatures in their hand or deck they lose the game. The person who played this card must summon their creature to the field prior to their opponent.

cards.title: Junk Scarecrow
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After a creature has been hit and prior to the damage step, play this card to the field. This card negates the attack from the attacking creature. After this card has negated the attacking creatures attack send this card to the cemetery. This card can be placed back into your hand from the cemetery at the beginning of the turn after 3 turn cycles. If this card is negated and sent to the cemetery during its activation the effect of returning from the cemetery is no longer valid.

cards.title: Knight
cards.flavorText: Knights are warriors of peace. They have devoted their lives to the pursuit of eradicating evil and upholding justice. They were the most feared warriors during The Empire of Man. They now serve The Order.
cards.otherAttributes: Holding a weapon. Has a sweet cape!
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Knight Armor
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 5. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Kobold
cards.flavorText: Kobolds are often deemed evil due to their constant aggression towards the dwarves. But in truth they are extremely competitive for resources. This often leads to conflict with other subterranean races.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Kraken
cards.flavorText: The Kraken is feared by many lesser creatures, as it is extremely aggressive and has no loyalties. Naval armadas will often avoid battle if there were rumors of a kraken nearby.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the target creature is wrapped. After being wrapped the wrapped creature may roll a die once per turn cycle to try and free themselves. To free themselves they must roll a 3-5, otherwise they take 10 damage. Wrap damage is applied after the combat phase in which it was applied and at the end of the combat phase after each subsequent turn cycle until the creature successfully rolls out of being wrapped. If battle did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up” .

cards.title: Lucky Charm
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Magic Belt
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Magic Ring
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 5. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Magic Steal
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When your opponent activates a magic card, negate the effect. After the effect has been negated, take the card from your opponent. Once that card has been taken you must immediately use the stolen card before continuing. If you cannot use the card for any reason the card is instead sent to your opponent's cemetery instead.

cards.title: Manticore
cards.flavorText: The Manticore is an abomination of splicing a lion, demon, and a fire spirit together. This beast was created by the Demon King in mockery of The Creator’s perfect plan.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Mimic Chest
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During battle, play this card from your hand and negate an attacking creature's attack. After negating the attack reduce the attacking creature's health points by half of its remaining health points. If half is an odd number, round up to the nearest whole number.

cards.title: Mind Sap
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When a creature is summoned, or while a creature already on the field, equip this card to a target creature. This card negates the effect of the creature it is currently equipped to. This card is continuous and is treated as an infinite equip card while attached to the target creature.

cards.title: Minotaur
cards.flavorText: Often found in subterranean labyrinths. Minotaurs are naturally peaceful creatures. They have allied themselves with The Cabal gue to The Order seeing them as nothing more than mindless beasts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits roll 1 die. If the result is a 5 or 6 the creature this card hits is stunned and cannot rebuttal or initiate battle for 1 turn cycle.

cards.title: Minotaur Bodyguard
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After a creature has been hit and prior to the damage step, play this card to the field. This card negates the attack from the attacking creature. After this card has negated the attacking creatures attack send this card to the cemetery.

cards.title: Mounted Assault
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Speed stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Mysterious Door
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card from your hand when your opponent plays a magic card to the field, or activates its effect from their hand. Deal 10 damage to your primary creature. After taking the 10 damage, negate the activation/playing of that magic card and send it to your opponents cemetery. After this card has been used, send it to the cemetery. This card can be placed back into your hand from the cemetery at the beginning of the turn after 3 turn cycles. If this card is negated and sent to the cemetery during its activation the effect of returning from the cemetery is no longer valid.

cards.title: Mysterious Traveler
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Armor Level and Speed stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Mythosaurus
cards.flavorText: This flying creature is a mostly peaceful creature. They are known to fly at low altitudes in search of food. Sometimes they are mistaken for Dragonlings.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Naga
cards.flavorText: The Naga were once ancient humans tainted by foul demonic magic. They fled to the seas to escape the first demonic invasion. This twisted their human bodies into serpent-like beasts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the target creature takes 10 poison damage once per turn cycle for 2 turn cycles. Damage is applied after the combat phase in which it was applied and at the end of the combat phase after 1 full turn cycle. If battle did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up”.

cards.title: Necromancer
cards.flavorText: Although not evil, necromancers delve into the forbidden arcane arts of summoning the dead back to life. Demons have a strong hatred for these masters of the undead, as they are seen as stealing souls from Hell.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field you may summon a creature from your cemetery to the field as a limited summon. You may only have 1 limited summoned creature brought to the field by this effect at a time. If the Necromancer is removed from the field the resurrected creature is sent to the cemetery. If the Necromancer's effect is negated send the resurrected creature back to the cemetery. If the card negating the Necromancer's effect is removed from the field, the Necromancer regains his effect and can summon a creature to the field using his effect.

cards.title: Ogre
cards.flavorText: An incredibly strong creature and prized trophy for adventurers. Ogres have been hunted to near extinction. They are now very rare and avoid large populated areas.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Orc
cards.flavorText: Orcs are the product of generic experimentation. They were designed to be the perfect super soldier. However, the manipulation made them uncontrollable and relentlessly violent.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: During your Attack dice roll if you roll a 6 for damage the resulting damage after all other calculations is doubled. If you have more Attack dice added from other card effects only 1 die must result in a 6 to gain this effect.

cards.title: Owl
cards.flavorText: Old and wise. Owls spend their nights hunting small rodents for food. They care little for the troubles of the larger world. During the winter months, they watch over the cold empty cabins of the northern woods.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Owlverine
cards.flavorText: The Owlverine is thought to be only a legend. They come out at night and pray to the moon. It’s an old wives tale that children who venture out into the forest after dark, are taken by the Owlverine and cursed to become children of the forest.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This creature does 2x damage to any creature that has a background of Forest. This can be seen from the creature's picture and/or the extended card descriptions list. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=3, +5 dmg for modifier, 2x for the creature effect, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows: (3+5)*2(Effect)*2(Critical)=32 total Attack damage to the target creature. Use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage.

cards.title: Phoenix
cards.flavorText: This magnificent creature was born from the Flame of the Infinite. When a phoenix dies, it is reborn out of its own ashes. Necromancers have attempted to uncover the secreets of the phoenix throughout the ages.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Return this creature to your hand If this card dies due to the result of battle or is killed by an effect that would cause damage to its life points.

cards.title: Psychic Toad
cards.flavorText: This small creature has the power to control the mind of others. Rumor is that the Creator loves these creatures and gifted a few with immense power. But this is only rumor.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature is summoned to the field take control of your opponent's creature as a limited summon. Return the controlled creature to the original owner’s hand if this card leaves the battlefield, switches control, or this effect is negated.

cards.title: Pumpkin Man
cards.flavorText: An ancient spirit that rises during the harvest to reap unlucky farmers. It is the focus of many campfire stories told by teenagers on dark nights.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Ranger
cards.flavorText: An outcast from the world. Rangers are expert hunters, trackers, and survivalists. Sometimes Kings will leave their royalty behind for the life of a Ranger.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field all creatures under your opponents control must roll a die prior to initiating combat or rebutling during battle. If the result is 3-6 your opponent may attack as normal. Each creature your opponent controls must make this dice roll individually to attempt an attack.

cards.title: Raptor
cards.flavorText: Cunning and intelligent. These creatures are some of the most feared dinosaurs due to their ability to set clever traps for their prey. Avoid the long grass when these creatures are nearby.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Red Dragon
cards.flavorText: A being of pure terror and destruction. Its flames are able to melt steel. They are considered the strongest of the dragons. The once ruled all of Ward after the ward with the dinosaurs.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Revival Priest
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field. This card allows the player who used this card to revive a creature from their cemetery and place it on the field as your primary creature. If you already have a primary creature on the field this card sends the primary creature that is already on the field back to your hand. This card remains equipped to the revived creature until the revived creature is removed from the field. If Revival Priest is destroyed or removed from the field the revived creature is sent to your cemetery. If the equipped creature of revival priest changes control and revival priest falls off then the equipped creature is killed and sent to your cemetery.

cards.title: Rodent
cards.flavorText: A small animal that lives in the forest. It comes out at night to scavenge for food.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Rogue
cards.flavorText: Stealthy and quick, the Rogue will kill a target before they realize they’ve been assaulted. On occasion, they will team up with an assassin for tougher contracts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: If this card hits first during combat triple the final damage number after all other damage calculations. This effect can work in conjunction with critical hits and other multiplying card effects, use PEMDAS to calculate the overall damage. An example of this would look like the following: Dice roll attack damage=5, +0 dmg for modifier, 3x for the creature effect, 3x for the magic card Backstab, and 2x for critical hit. The final math equation would be as follows (5+0)*3(Effect)*2(Critical)*3(Backstab)=90 total Attack damage to the target creature.

cards.title: Scarecrow
cards.flavorText: This creepy straw humanoid was accidentally brought to life by a necromancer's failed experiments. With no purpose, the scarecrow roams the fields, killing.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Sentinel of Life
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: After your opponent finishes their attack dice rolls and applies any additional damage calculations from battle, play this card. Negate any damage the target creature would have taken and instead heal the targeted creature for that amount of damage.

cards.title: Shadow Demon
cards.flavorText: These demons are conjured from the shadows by evil deeds. Most of the time, they just like to watch.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Silence from the Grave
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: You must discard 1 magic card to your cemetery to play this card to the field. On activation destroy all magic cards on the field. After destroying all the magic cards on the field this card remains on the field and negates your opponent’s creature effects and they cannot play magic cards. This card lasts for 2 turn cycles and then is sent to your cemetery.

cards.title: Skeleton
cards.flavorText: A mindless pile of bones. Skeletons serve the call of their master who have raised them into undeath. During their free time from serving their masterm they enjoy dancing in a spooky and scary way.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Smokescreen
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a target creature. For 2 turn cycles the equipped creature can only roll 1 Hit dice. This effect overrides any additional Hit dice additions to creatures such as Sword of Light and only allows them to roll 1 Hit dice.

cards.title: Stone Golem
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to your opponent's side of the field as a summoned creature. This card does not require sacrifices to summon to your opponent's side of the field as it is acting as a magic card while in your hand initially. Once summoned to your opponent's side of the field, send the targeted player's primary creature back to their deck and then they need to reshuffle their deck. While this card is on the field this card loses 10 Health Points at the beginning of the players turn who currently has this card on the field. This creature will go into the cemetery of the player who controls it when it dies and remains a creature in the cemetery and if it is revived from the cemetery. If this card is negated it does not become a creature and remains as a magic card in your cemetery. If this card is a magic card in your cemetery, its Health Points do not count towards your total cemetery health points towards losing the match.

cards.title: Surprise from the Deep
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 5 each for 1 turn cycle. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Swamp Dragon
cards.flavorText: Swamp dragons are smaller and weaker than most other types of dragons. They often prey on much weaker creatures, such as Frog Men, to show their dominance.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: This card can only be damaged by battle damage. Other forms of damaging effects such as magic cards, Damage over time, reflection damage(Non-Creature), and other damaging effects outside of standard battle damage do not affect this card. Effects that would multiply standard battle damage still affect this card.

cards.title: Sword of Light
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3 each. Additionally, add 1 Dice roll to the equipped creatures Attack dice roll and Hit dice roll. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Sword of the Grove
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Attack Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 5. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: Sword of the Jungle
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

cards.title: T-Rex
cards.flavorText: This creature is older and more ferocious than even the dragons. They often feed on unsuspecting dragons who venture too close to the ground.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Terrifying Roar
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Send a target creature on your opponents side of the field back to their current owner's hand. This card is a single use and sent to the cemetery after its effect has concluded.

cards.title: The Creator
cards.flavorText: The celestial of all things. None can rival his power. The Creator is all knowing, all powerful, and infinite. He created the universe, and all that exists in it. For some reason, he holds a fascination for the planet Ward.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Requires 3 creatures to be sacrificed to summon this card to the field. This is considered a summoning requirement and is not to be treated as an effect. This card should be treated as a non-effect creature. This requirement cannot be negated during summoning by cards such as Demonic Magic or Mind Sap.

cards.title: The Hero
cards.flavorText: An immortal spirit that is said to replace the souls of newborn babies. Its vanity makes it need to be The Hero in each of its lifetimes. Every story needs a Hero.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field, if a creature is sent to your opponents cemetery for any reason increase this card's Attack Dice Rolls and Hit/Attack Modifier stats of this creature by +1. This effect does not persist if The Hero is removed from the field and then resummoned.

cards.title: The Heroine
cards.flavorText: A woman of pure determination and heroism. She often teams up with The Hero for many adventures.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Increase this card's Attack Dice Rolls and Hit/Attack Modifier stats of this creature by +1 for each creature currently in your opponents cemetery.

cards.title: The Old God
cards.flavorText: A mysterious being who travels the cosmos seeking out lower lifeforms to worship it. It was worshiped across Ward until The Creator banished it. The Old Ones dare not emerge during the time of The Old God.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Requires 3 creatures to be sacrificed to summon this card to the field. This is considered a summoning requirement and is not to be treated as an effect. This card should be treated as a non-effect creature. This requirement cannot be negated during summoning by cards such as Demonic Magic or Mind Sap.

cards.title: The Squire
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: You may summon this magic card to your side of the field alongside your primary creature as a Limited Summon creature. If this card leaves the field it is considered a magic card again. If this card is in your cemetery for any reason its health points do not count towards your total cemetery health points. While this card is on the field as a Limited summon it cannot be used as a sacrifice. If it becomes your primary creature it can be used as a sacrifice for other creatures.

cards.title: Troll Regeneration
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a target creature. At the beginning of your turn, heal the equipped creature for 5 health points.

cards.title: Turncoat
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field and switch primary creatures with your opponent's creature. Each player's creature keeps its current health points during this change of ownership. Any status effects such as stun or DOT’s would remain on the creature until the effect is concluded or removed by other means. Any equip cards that are attached to either creature are removed during this exchange. In the event a creature would die due to this exchange such as revival priest was attached to one of the creatures the creature who had revival priest attached would die and be sent to the cemetery of the owner of revival priest. The player without the revival priest would then give their opponent their creature and need to summon a new creature as the player who had the creature equipped revival priest now has no creature to exchange.

cards.title: Twister
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Destroy all magic cards on the field. Once all magic cards have been destroyed each player must draw 2 cards from the top of their deck, if they can.

cards.title: Undead Dragon
cards.flavorText: These resurrected monstrosities were once special guardians of The Cosmos who fell from grace.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Undead Knight
cards.flavorText: These knights once served the King of Dead until he was defeated by the Eternal Dragon in battle. Now they roam endlessly trying to fulfill the vision of their king.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Unlucky Circumstance
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a creature on the field. Once equipped the equipped creature has its Armor Level reduced to 1. This card supersedes any buff cards that would increase the targeted creatures Armor Level. This card lasts for one turn cycle and then is sent to the cemetery of the player who used this card. After the one turn cycle timer has concluded this card is removed at the beginning of the player's turn, before they draw their card in their draw phase.

cards.title: Vampire
cards.flavorText: These undead creatures come out at night to feed on the blood of their prey. Were-creatures and vampires share a mutual hatred for each other. They may be undead, but they despise the Empire of the Damned.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Heal this card for half of the total attack damage that is dealt by this card during battle. If the damage from this card is blocked or reflected the healing effect does not apply. This healing effect only applies to damage dealt by this card during battle. Other damage dealt through other means such as DOTs, or other card effects are NOT included in the damage and healing calculations. Vampire cannot heal over its current total health.

cards.title: Visitor from Beyond
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Return 1 magic from your cemetery back to your hand.

cards.title: Warg
cards.flavorText: Wargs travel in large packs and commit brutal attacks against common folk, often just for sport.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When this creature hits, the target creature takes 10 bleed damage once per turn cycle for 1 turn cycle. Bleed Damage is applied after the combat phase in which it was applied is over and at the end of the combat phase after 1 full turn cycle. If combat did not occur, apply it prior to phase 4 “Wrap-up” .

cards.title: Watcher in the Wall
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field. Your opponent must present the cards they currently have in their hand to you. You may choose one card in their hand and force your opponent to send that card to the bottom of their deck, DO NOT reshuffle because of this effect.

cards.title: Werecroc
cards.flavorText: Similar to a werewolf, the Werecroc is a human that has been infected by another Werecroc and is now forced to dawn the visage of this scaled beast.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Werewolf
cards.flavorText: Blood thirsty and savage monsters. Werewolves were once men who have been infected by the disease of lycanthropy. They are now slaves to their savage animalistic instincts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: N/A

cards.title: Wings of the Beast
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a creature on the field. Once equipped the equipped creature gains the “Wings Attribute” and cannot be attacked by a creature without wings for 1 turn cycle. If two creatures who normally don't have “Wings” as an attribute have “Wings of the Beast” attached to them, they may attack each other while this card is attached.

cards.title: Winter Chill
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a creature on the field. Once equipped the equipped creature is frozen. Frozen creatures cannot initiate combat, rebuttal during combat, or be used as a sacrifice. During your opponent's turn they may roll a die to try to unfreeze the equipped creature. If the result of the dice roll is a 5 or 6 the equipped creature is unfrozen and this card is sent to the cemetery.

cards.title: Witch
cards.flavorText: Wicked women that study the dark arcane arts. They capture men and beasts, sacrificing them to the Old God in hopes of gaining its favor.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: When summoned, target a creature on the field and reduce its Armor Level to 1 until the Witch leaves the field or this effect is negated. This card supersedes any buff cards that would increase the targeted creatures Armor Level.

cards.title: Wizard
cards.flavorText: Old, wise, powerful, and a little crazy. Wizards spend their lives in the pursuit of unlocking and perfecting the secrets of the arcane arts.
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Any time during your turn you may roll 1 dice. If the result is a 1-3 block the next attack from a creature that would hit the Wizard. This shield does not block effects such as DOTs and damage that is caused by magic cards. If the attack from a creature that would apply a DOT is blocked by the Wizards effect the DOT from that attack does not apply to the Wizard.

cards.title: Wrath of the Old Ones
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Play this card to the field. This card returns all primary creatures and magic cards on the field back to their original owners deck. The original owner's deck is whoever began the game with that card in their deck. After returning all cards from the field back to their respective decks, shuffle the decks and draw the same number of cards from your decks that you removed from your side of the field.

cards.title: Zombified
cards.flavorText: N/A
cards.extendedEffectDescription: Equip this card to a creature on the field. Once equipped the equipped creature has its current Armor Level reduced by 2 once per turn cycle. The Armor Level reduction is applied at the beginning of the player who played this card. Zombified cancels any other Armor Level increasing effects that would apply to the equipped card.
